00047 /**
00048  * Constructor.
00049  *
00050  */
00051 ArtifactReduction::ArtifactReduction() {
00052     setUpSelfDoc(*this);
00053     m_Type = getDocName();
00054     m_SafetyZero=0.1;
00055 
00056     //
00057     m_TransformedIMart = NULL;
00058     m_DataCache = NULL;
00059     m_NumChannels = 0;
00060     m_a5_filename="";
00061     m_a5_shared_group=NULL;
00062     m_pobjChipLayout = NULL;
00063     m_FreeLayout = false;
00064     m_CurCount = 0;
00065     m_Clip = -1;
00066     m_Open = -1;
00067     m_Close = -1;
00068     m_Fringe = -1;
00069     m_ResType = -1;
00070     m_MapVerbose = -1;
00071     m_CoincidenceCount = -1;
00072     m_TrustCheck = false;
00073     m_dc_k = 0;
00074     m_Gradient = 0;
00075 
00076 }

00078 /**
00079  * Destructor.
00080  */
00081 ArtifactReduction::~ArtifactReduction() {
00082 
00083     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ToFree.size(); i++) {
00084         delete m_ToFree[i];
00085     }
00086     if (m_FreeLayout) {
00087         Freez(m_pobjChipLayout);
00088     }
00089     Freez(m_DataCache);
00090     m_ProbesetTrustTsv.clear();
00091 }

00093 /**
00094  * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00095  * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00096  */
00097 void ArtifactReduction::setUpSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00098     doc.setDocName(ARTIFACTREDUCTIONSTR);
00099     doc.setDocDescription("Class for artifact reduction.");
00100     doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00101 }

00103 /**
00104  * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00105  * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00106  */
00107 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> ArtifactReduction::getDefaultDocOptions() {
00108     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00109 
00110     SelfDoc::Opt o_Clip = {"Clip", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "2.0","0.0","0","NA",
00111                            "Threshold for intensity log-ratio to be outlier"};
00112     opts.push_back(o_Clip);
00113 
00114     SelfDoc::Opt o_Open = {"Open",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "1","0","0","NA",
00115                            "Minimum size of snow (isolated residuals) to remove"};
00116     opts.push_back(o_Open);
00117 
00118     SelfDoc::Opt o_Close = {"Close",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "3","0","0","NA",
00119                             "Max gap to close between tentative artifacts"};
00120     opts.push_back(o_Close);
00121 
00122     SelfDoc::Opt o_Fringe= {"Fringe", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "2","0","0","NA",
00123                             "Add a fringe to catch border features that might be poor."};
00124     opts.push_back(o_Fringe);
00125 
00126     SelfDoc::Opt o_ResType = {"ResType",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "2","1","1","NA",
00127                               "Type=1 raw intensity, type=2 replicate comparison"};
00128     opts.push_back(o_ResType);
00129 
00130     SelfDoc::Opt o_MapVerbose = {"MapVerbose", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"0","0","0","NA",
00131                                  "0=no map, 1=map, 2=map+profiles"};
00132     opts.push_back(o_MapVerbose);
00133     SelfDoc::Opt o_CC = {"CC", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "1","1","1","NA",
00134                          "How many channels must support an artifact"};
00135     opts.push_back(o_CC);
00136     SelfDoc::Opt o_tc = {"TrustCheck",SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean,"false","false","NA","NA",
00137                          "Completely untrusted, blimeshed probesets in samples are no-calls"};
00138     opts.push_back(o_tc);
00139     SelfDoc::Opt o_dc = {"DC",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"8","0","NA","NA",
00140                          "Region of block to average for gradient"};
00141     opts.push_back(o_dc);
00142     SelfDoc::Opt o_Gradient = {"Gradient",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"0","0","NA","NA",
00143                                "Do gradient removal"};
00144     opts.push_back(o_Gradient);
00145 
00146 
00147     return opts;
00148 }

00151 /**
00152  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00153  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00154  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00155  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00156  *
00157  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00158  *
00159  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00160  */
00161 SelfCreate *ArtifactReduction::newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
00162     SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00163 
00164     ArtifactReduction *qnorm = new ArtifactReduction();
00165 
00166     // created generic, now fill in values from param string
00167     fillInValue(qnorm->m_Clip, "Clip", param,doc);
00168     fillInValue(qnorm->m_Open, "Open", param, doc);
00169     fillInValue(qnorm->m_Close,"Close",param, doc);
00170     fillInValue(qnorm->m_ResType,"ResType",param,doc);
00171     fillInValue(qnorm->m_MapVerbose,"MapVerbose",param,doc);
00172     fillInValue(qnorm->m_Fringe,"Fringe",param,doc);
00173     fillInValue(qnorm->m_CoincidenceCount, "CC", param, doc);
00174     fillInValue(qnorm->m_TrustCheck,"TrustCheck",param,doc);
00175     fillInValue(qnorm->m_dc_k,"DC",param,doc);
00176     fillInValue(qnorm->m_Gradient,"Gradient",param,doc);
00177 
00178     qnorm->setOptValue("Clip", ToStr(qnorm->m_Clip));
00179     qnorm->setOptValue("Open", ToStr(qnorm->m_Open));
00180     qnorm->setOptValue("Close", ToStr(qnorm->m_Close));
00181     qnorm->setOptValue("ResType", ToStr(qnorm->m_ResType));
00182     qnorm->setOptValue("MapVerbose", ToStr(qnorm->m_MapVerbose));
00183     qnorm->setOptValue("Fringe", ToStr(qnorm->m_Fringe));
00184     qnorm->setOptValue("CC", ToStr(qnorm->m_CoincidenceCount));
00185     qnorm->setOptValue("TrustCheck", qnorm->m_TrustCheck);
00186     qnorm->setOptValue("DC", ToStr(qnorm->m_dc_k));
00187     qnorm->setOptValue("Gradient", ToStr(qnorm->m_Gradient));
00188 
00189     return qnorm;
00190 
00191     
00192 
00193 
00194 }

00199 void ArtifactReduction::updateReference(std::vector<float> &data) {
00200     if (m_CurCount==0) {
00201         m_ReferenceProfile=data;
00202         for (int i=0; i<data.size(); i++)
00203             m_ReferenceProfile[i] = log(max(data[i],m_SafetyZero));
00204         m_CurCount = 1;
00205     }
00206     else{
00207         // compute stable on-line mean
00208         // So we don't have to read in all the data at any time
00209         // Or access things in weird orders
00210         m_CurCount++;
00211         for (int i=0; i<data.size(); i++) {
00212             m_ReferenceProfile[i] +=
00213                 (log(max(data[i],m_SafetyZero)) -
00214                  m_ReferenceProfile[i]) / m_CurCount;
00215         }
00216     }
00217 }
00218 
00219 void ArtifactReduction::updateAllReference(std::vector<std::vector<float> > &adata) {
00220     if (m_CurCount==0) {
00221         m_AllReferenceProfile.clear();
00222         m_AllReferenceProfile.resize(adata.size());
00223         for (int cd=0; cd<adata.size(); cd++) {
00224             m_AllReferenceProfile[cd].assign(adata[cd].size(),0);
00225             for (int i=0; i<adata[cd].size(); i++)
00226                 m_AllReferenceProfile[cd][i] = log(max(adata[cd][i],
00227                                                        m_SafetyZero));
00228         }
00229         m_CurCount = 1;
00230     }
00231     else{
00232         // compute stable on-line mean
00233         // So we don't have to read in all the data at any time
00234         // Or access things in weird orders
00235         m_CurCount++;
00236         for (int cd=0; cd<adata.size(); cd++) {
00237             for (int i=0; i<adata[cd].size(); i++) {
00238                 m_AllReferenceProfile[cd][i] +=
00239                     (log(max(adata[cd][i],m_SafetyZero)) -
00240                      m_AllReferenceProfile[cd][i]) / m_CurCount;
00241             }
00242         }
00243     }
00244 }

00246 
00247 float ArtifactReduction::TypeIResidual(std::vector<float> &resid,
00248                                        std::vector<float> &data,
00249                                        std::vector<float> &ref) {
00250     // construct residuals to an intensity profile
00251 
00252     float mt;
00253     resid=data;
00254     mt = 0;
00255     for (int i=0; i<data.size(); i++) {
00256         resid[i] = log(max(data[i],m_SafetyZero))-ref[i];
00257         mt += (resid[i]-mt)/(i+1);
00258     }
00259     //  Verbose::out(3, "Mean " + ToStr(mt) + " is the mean of me");
00260     for (int i=0; i<data.size(); i++) {
00261         resid[i] -= mt;
00262     }
00263 
00264     return(mt);
00265 }
00266 
00267 void ArtifactReduction::TypeTwoResidual(std::vector<float> &resid,
00268                                         std::vector<float> &data) {
00269     // set up residual matrix to be zero everywhere
00270     resid.clear();
00271     resid.assign(data.size(),0);
00272 
00273     int goodcount;
00274     float goodmean;
00275     long index;
00276     long psetCount;
00277     std::vector<int> probeIds;
00278     // iterate over all probe sets
00279     //
00280     psetCount = m_pobjChipLayout->getProbeSetCount();
00281     for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < psetCount; psIx++) {
00282         ProbeListPacked pl = m_pobjChipLayout->getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00283         // Perhaps we only want to consider genotyping/marker probeset types
00284         if ((pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::GenoType) ||
00285             (pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::Marker) ||
00286             (pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker)) {
00287             int blockCount=pl.block_cnt();
00288             pl.get_probeIds(probeIds);
00289             int pIxStart = 0;
00290             for (int bIx=0;bIx<blockCount;bIx++) {
00291                 // We now assume that all of the following probes in this block
00292                 // are identical or perhaps we only make this assumption for
00293                 // genotype/marker probeset types
00294                 int blockSize=pl.get_blockSize(bIx);
00295                 goodcount = 0;
00296                 goodmean = 0;
00297                 for (int pIx=pIxStart; pIx < pIxStart + blockSize; pIx++) {
00298                     if (1 /*pl.isPm(pIx)*/) {
00299                         // Do something
00300                         //index = pl.get_probeId(pIx);
00301                         index = probeIds[pIx];
00302                         goodcount++;
00303                         goodmean += (log(max(data[index],m_SafetyZero)) -
00304                                      goodmean) / goodcount;
00305                     }
00306                 } // End for loop over probes
00307 
00308                 // now get residuals for all probes from mean
00309                 // median might be better, but should be good enough
00310                 for (int pIx=pIxStart; pIx < pIxStart + blockSize; pIx++) {
00311                     if (1 /*pl.isPm(pIx)*/) {
00312                         // Do something
00313                         //index = pl.get_probeId(pIx);
00314                         index = probeIds[pIx];
00315                         resid[index] = log(max(data[index],m_SafetyZero))-goodmean;
00316                     }
00317                 } // End for loop over probes again
00318                 pIxStart += blockSize; // update by current block to go to next block
00319 
00320             } // End for loop over blocks
00321         } // End if genotype/marker probeset type
00322     } // End for loop over probesets
00323 }
00324 
00325 void ArtifactReduction::EmptyBlemishes(std::vector<int> &tmpBlemish,
00326                                        std::vector<float> &tmpRes) {
00327     // make no blemishes here
00328     tmpBlemish.assign(tmpRes.size(),0);
00329 }
00330 
00331 long ArtifactReduction::ThresholdResiduals(std::vector<int> &tmpBlemish,
00332                                            std::vector<float> &tmpRes,
00333                                            float Clip) {
00334     long dumb_count=0;
00335 
00336     //tmpBlemish.assign(tmpRes.size(),0);
00337 
00338     for (int i=0; i<tmpRes.size(); i++) {
00339         if (tmpRes[i]>Clip) {
00340             tmpBlemish[i]+=1;
00341             dumb_count++;
00342         }
00343         if (tmpRes[i]< (-1*Clip)) {
00344             tmpBlemish[i]+=1;
00345             dumb_count++;
00346         }
00347     }
00348     return(dumb_count);
00349 }
00350 
00351 int ArtifactReduction::EraseBlemishToReference(std::vector<float> &data,
00352                                                std::vector<float> &ref,
00353                                                std::vector<int> &blemishes,
00354                                                float mt) {
00355     // erases blemishes by resetting to reference
00356     // this is the worst possible method and is only used for testing
00357     int dumb_count=0;
00358     for (int i=0; i<blemishes.size(); i++) {
00359         if (blemishes[i]>0) {
00360             data[i] = exp(ref[i] + mt);
00361             dumb_count++;
00362         }
00363     }
00364     return(dumb_count);
00365 }
00366 
00367 void ArtifactReduction::FixProbeIterationList() {
00368     // generate a probe iteration list over replicates
00369     //int replace_count=0;
00370     int goodcount;
00371     float goodmean;
00372     long index=0;
00373     long psetCount;
00374     // iterate over all probe sets
00375     //
00376     m_ProbeIterationList.clear();
00377     vector<int> tmpReplicateList;
00378 
00379     psetCount = m_pobjChipLayout->getProbeSetCount();
00380     for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < psetCount; psIx++) {
00381         ProbeListPacked pl = m_pobjChipLayout->getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00382         // Perhaps we only want to consider genotyping/marker probeset types
00383         if ((pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::GenoType) ||
00384             (pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::Marker) ||
00385             (pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker)) {
00386 
00387             int blockCount=pl.block_cnt();
00388             int pIxStart = 0;
00389             for (int bIx=0;bIx<blockCount;bIx++) {
00390                 // We now assume that all of the following probes in this block
00391                 // are identical or perhaps we only make this assumption for
00392                 // genotype/marker probeset types
00393                 int blockSize=pl.get_blockSize(bIx);
00394                 goodcount = 0;
00395                 goodmean = 0;
00396                 tmpReplicateList.clear();
00397                 for (int pIx=pIxStart; pIx < pIxStart + blockSize; pIx++) {
00398                     if (1 ) {//pl.isPm(pIx)
00399                         // Do something
00400                         index = pl.get_probeId(pIx);
00401                         tmpReplicateList.push_back(index);
00402                     }
00403                 } // End for loop over probes
00404                 m_ProbeIterationList.push_back(tmpReplicateList);
00405                 pIxStart += blockSize; // update by current block to go to next block
00406 
00407             } // End for loop over blocks
00408         } // End if genotype/marker probeset type
00409     } // End for loop over probesets
00410 }

00413 void ArtifactReduction::NewTypeTwoResidual(std::vector<float> &resid,
00414                                            std::vector<float> &data) {
00415     // set up residual matrix to be zero everywhere
00416     resid.clear();
00417     resid.assign(data.size(),0);
00418 
00419     int goodcount;
00420     float goodmean;
00421     long index;
00422     long psetCount;
00423     // iterate over all probe sets
00424     //
00425     psetCount = m_ProbeIterationList.size();
00426     for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < psetCount; psIx++) {
00427         goodmean=0;
00428         goodcount = 0;
00429 
00430         for (int pIx=0; pIx < m_ProbeIterationList[psIx].size(); pIx++) {
00431             if (1 /*pl.isPm(pIx)*/) {
00432                 // Do something
00433                 index = m_ProbeIterationList[psIx][pIx];
00434                 goodcount++;
00435                 goodmean +=
00436                     (log(max(data[index],m_SafetyZero))-goodmean)/goodcount;
00437             }
00438         } // End for loop over probes
00439 
00440         // now get residuals for all probes from mean
00441         // median might be better, but should be good enough
00442         for (int pIx=0; pIx < m_ProbeIterationList[psIx].size(); pIx++) {
00443             if (1 /*pl.isPm(pIx)*/) {
00444                 // Do something
00445                 index = m_ProbeIterationList[psIx][pIx];
00446                 resid[index] = log(max(data[index],m_SafetyZero))-goodmean;
00447             }
00448         } // End for loop over probes again
00449 
00450     } // End for loop over probesets
00451 }
00452 
00453 int ArtifactReduction::NewEraseBlemishToUnblemished(std::vector<float> &data,
00454                                                     std::vector<int> &blemishes) {
00455 
00456     int replace_count=0;
00457     int goodcount;
00458     float goodmean;
00459     long index=0;
00460     long psetCount;
00461     // iterate over all probe sets
00462     //
00463     psetCount = m_ProbeIterationList.size();
00464     for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < psetCount; psIx++) {
00465 
00466 
00467         goodcount = 0;
00468         goodmean = 0;
00469         for (int pIx=0; pIx < m_ProbeIterationList[psIx].size(); pIx++) {
00470             if (1 ) {//pl.isPm(pIx)
00471                 // Do something
00472                 index = m_ProbeIterationList[psIx][pIx];
00473                 if (blemishes[index]<1) {
00474                     goodcount++;
00475                     goodmean += (data[index]-goodmean)/goodcount;
00476                 }
00477             }
00478         } // End for loop over probes
00479 
00480         // now substitute unblemished for blemished if possible
00481         for (int pIx=0; pIx < m_ProbeIterationList[psIx].size(); pIx++) {
00482             if (1 ) {//pl.isPm(pIx)
00483                 // Do something
00484                 index = m_ProbeIterationList[psIx][pIx];
00485                 if (blemishes[index]>0 && goodcount>0) {
00486                     data[index] = goodmean;
00487                     replace_count++;
00488                 }
00489             }
00490         } // End for loop over probes again
00491 
00492 
00493     } // End for loop over probesets
00494     return(replace_count);
00495 }
00496 
00497 int ArtifactReduction::EraseBlemishToUnblemished(std::vector<float> &data,
00498                                                  std::vector<int> &blemishes) {
00499 
00500     int replace_count=0;
00501     int goodcount;
00502     float goodmean;
00503     long index=0;
00504     long psetCount;
00505     std::vector<int> probeIds;
00506 
00507     // iterate over all probe sets
00508     //
00509     psetCount = m_pobjChipLayout->getProbeSetCount();
00510     for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < psetCount; psIx++) {
00511         ProbeListPacked pl = m_pobjChipLayout->getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00512         // Perhaps we only want to consider genotyping/marker probeset types
00513         if ((pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::GenoType) ||
00514             (pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::Marker) ||
00515             (pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker)) {
00516 
00517             int blockCount=pl.block_cnt();
00518             pl.get_probeIds(probeIds);
00519             int pIxStart = 0;
00520             for (int bIx=0;bIx<blockCount;bIx++) {
00521                 // We now assume that all of the following probes in this block are identical
00522                 // or perhaps we only make this assumption for genotype/marker probeset types
00523                 int blockSize=pl.get_blockSize(bIx);
00524                 goodcount = 0;
00525                 goodmean = 0;
00526                 for (int pIx=pIxStart; pIx < pIxStart + blockSize; pIx++) {
00527                     if (1 ) {//pl.isPm(pIx)
00528                         // Do something
00529                         //index = pl.get_probeId(pIx);
00530                         index = probeIds[pIx];
00531                         if (blemishes[index]<1) {
00532                             goodcount++;
00533                             goodmean += (data[index]-goodmean)/goodcount;
00534                         }
00535                     }
00536                 } // End for loop over probes
00537 
00538                 // now substitute unblemished for blemished if possible
00539                 for (int pIx=pIxStart; pIx < pIxStart + blockSize; pIx++) {
00540                     if (1 ) {//pl.isPm(pIx)
00541                         // Do something
00542                         //index = pl.get_probeId(pIx);
00543                         index = probeIds[pIx];
00544                         if (blemishes[index]>0 && goodcount>0) {
00545                             data[index] = goodmean;
00546                             replace_count++;
00547                         }
00548                     }
00549                 } // End for loop over probes again
00550                 pIxStart += blockSize; // update by current block to go to next block
00551 
00552             } // End for loop over blocks
00553         } // End if genotype/marker probeset type
00554     } // End for loop over probesets
00555     return(replace_count);
00556 }
00557 
00558 int ArtifactReduction::BlemishedByProbeset(int ChipId, std::vector<int> &blemishes) {
00559 
00560     int replace_count=0;
00561     int goodcount;
00562     float goodmean;
00563     long index=0;
00564     long psetCount;
00565     std::vector<int> probeIds;
00566     
00567     //m_ProbesetBlemishStream << ChipId;
00568     // iterate over all probe sets
00569     //
00570     psetCount = m_pobjChipLayout->getProbeSetCount();
00571     for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < psetCount; psIx++) {
00572         ProbeListPacked pl = m_pobjChipLayout->getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00573         // Perhaps we only want to consider genotyping/marker probeset types
00574         if ((pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::GenoType) || (pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::Marker) || (pl.get_type() == ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker)) {
00575             int blockCount=pl.block_cnt();
00576             pl.get_probeIds(probeIds);
00577             int pIxStart = 0;
00578             int bestcount=probeIds.size();  // at most number of probes trusted probes
00579             for (int bIx=0;bIx<blockCount;bIx++) {
00580                 // We now assume that all of the following probes in this block are identical
00581                 // or perhaps we only make this assumption for genotype/marker probeset types
00582                 int blockSize=pl.get_blockSize(bIx);
00583                 goodcount = 0;
00584                 goodmean = 0;
00585                 for (int pIx=pIxStart; pIx < pIxStart + blockSize; pIx++) {
00586                     if (1 ) {//pl.isPm(pIx)
00587                         // Do something
00588                         //index = pl.get_probeId(pIx);
00589                         index = probeIds[pIx];
00590                         if (blemishes[index]<1){
00591                             goodcount++;
00592                         }
00593                     }
00594                 } // End for loop over probes
00595                 if (goodcount<bestcount)
00596                     bestcount=goodcount;
00597                 
00598                 
00599                 pIxStart += blockSize; // update by current block to go to next block
00600                 
00601             } // End for loop over blocks
00602             // now we output 'worst' of all blocks
00603             // since we're just trying to make trust/notrust decision
00604             //  only output things not to trust!
00605             //  If we don't find them, they're trusted!
00606             if (bestcount<1){
00607                 m_ProbesetTrustTsv.set(0,"chp_id",ToStr(ChipId));
00608                 m_ProbesetTrustTsv.set(0,"probeset_id",pl.get_name_string());
00609                 m_ProbesetTrustTsv.set(0,"trust_count",bestcount);
00610                 m_ProbesetTrustTsv.writeLevel(0);
00611             }
00612         } // End if genotype/marker probeset type
00613     } // End for loop over probesets
00614     
00615     //m_ProbesetBlemishStream << endl;
00616     return(replace_count);
00617 }
00618 
00619 int sum_map(vector<int> &myb) {
00620     int tot=0;
00621     for (int i=0; i<myb.size(); i++)
00622         tot += myb[i];
00623     return(tot);
00624 }
00625 
00626 
00627 void threshold_map(vector<int> &myb, int t) {
00628     for (int i=0; i<myb.size(); i++)
00629         if (myb[i]>=t)
00630             myb[i] =1;
00631         else
00632             myb[i] = 0;
00633 }
00634 
00635 void ArtifactReduction::FixBlemish(std::vector<std::vector<float> > &adata,
00636                                    float Clip, int chipNo) {
00637     vector<float> tmp;
00638     vector<int> myblemishes;
00639 
00640     float mt;
00641     long dumb_count,x_count, raw_count, proc_count;
00642 
00643     dumb_count =0;
00644 
00645     // dumbest possible blemish corrector
00646     // Clip large residuals to end
00647     EmptyBlemishes(myblemishes,adata[0]);
00648 
00649     // blemishes aggregated over all channels
00650     // Assume channels represent same physical object here
00651     for (int cd=0; cd<adata.size(); cd++) {
00652 
00653         if (m_ResType==1)
00654             mt=TypeIResidual(tmp,adata[cd], m_AllReferenceProfile[cd]);
00655         if (m_ResType==2)
00656             TypeTwoResidual(tmp,adata[cd]);
00657 
00658         // save actual residuals here
00659         if (m_MapVerbose>0)
00660             saveResidualsToFile("residuals."+ToStr(chipNo)+".channel" +
00661                                 ToStr(cd) + ".txt",tmp,"ResType" +
00662                                 ToStr(m_ResType));
00663 
00664         dumb_count+=ThresholdResiduals(myblemishes,tmp,Clip);
00665     }
00666 
00667     // focus on ones for which sufficient channels agree there is a blemish
00668     threshold_map(myblemishes,m_CoincidenceCount);
00669 
00670     raw_count= sum_map(myblemishes);
00671 
00672     int Xdim = m_pobjChipLayout->getXCount();
00673     int Ydim = m_pobjChipLayout->getYCount();
00674 
00675     //Verbose::out(1,ToStr(Xdim) + ":" + ToStr(Ydim));
00676 
00677     // "close" maneuver to create contiguous regions
00678     dilate(myblemishes, Xdim, Ydim, m_Close);
00679     erode(myblemishes, Xdim, Ydim,m_Close);
00680 
00681     // "open maneuver to eliminate 'snow'
00682     erode(myblemishes,Xdim,Ydim,m_Open);
00683     dilate(myblemishes,Xdim,Ydim,m_Open);
00684 
00685     // "Dilate" maneuver to add "fringe" to all contiguous regions
00686     dilate(myblemishes,Xdim,Ydim,m_Fringe);
00687 
00688     proc_count = sum_map(myblemishes);
00689 
00690     //x_count = EraseBlemishToReference(adata[0], m_AllReferenceProfile[0], myblemishes, mt);
00691     x_count=0;
00692     for (int cd=0; cd<adata.size(); cd++)
00693         x_count += EraseBlemishToUnblemished(adata[cd],myblemishes);
00694 
00695     // output by construction
00696     if (m_TrustCheck) {
00697         BlemishedByProbeset(chipNo,myblemishes);
00698     }
00699 
00700     // blemish map constructed
00701     // output for debugging purposes
00702     if (m_MapVerbose>0)
00703         saveBlemishMapToFile("artifact."+ ToStr(chipNo) + ".map.txt",
00704                              myblemishes, "artifact");
00705 
00706 
00707     Verbose::out(3, "Found " + ToStr(raw_count*100.0/(Xdim*Ydim)) + " raw residuals " + ToStr(proc_count*100.0/(Xdim*Ydim)) + " processed");
00708 
00709 
00710 }
00711 
00712 void fix_residuals(vector<float> &data, vector<float> &res){
00713     for (int i=0; i<data.size(); i++){
00714         data[i] *= exp(-res[i]);
00715     }
00716 }
00717 
00718 void ArtifactReduction::FixGradient(std::vector<std::vector<float> > &adata, float Clip, int chipNo){
00719     // fixes gradients on the image, after worst artifacts have been removed
00720     // fixes gradient on each channel independently, as they can have different magnitude
00721     vector<float> tmp;
00722     
00723     float mt;
00724     
00725     int Xdim = m_pobjChipLayout->getXCount();
00726     int Ydim = m_pobjChipLayout->getYCount();
00727     
00728     // Assume channels represent same physical object here
00729     for (int cd=0; cd<adata.size(); cd++){
00730         
00731         // recompute residuals, as artifact reduction has changed things all over the snps
00732         if (m_ResType==1)
00733             mt=TypeIResidual(tmp,adata[cd], m_AllReferenceProfile[cd]);
00734         if (m_ResType==2)
00735             TypeTwoResidual(tmp,adata[cd]);
00736         
00737         // save actual residuals here
00738         if (m_MapVerbose>0)
00739             saveResidualsToFile("Gresiduals."+ToStr(chipNo)+".channel" +ToStr(cd) + ".txt",tmp,"ResType"+ToStr(m_ResType));
00740         
00741         // actually deal with the residuals in this channel
00742         // if m_dc_k were 0, get back residual matrix identity
00743         dc_block(tmp,Xdim,Ydim,m_dc_k);
00744         // remove residual
00745         fix_residuals(adata[cd],tmp);
00746     }
00747 }
00748 
00749 void ArtifactReduction::Winsorize(std::vector<float> &data,
00750                                   std::vector<float> &ref,
00751                                   float Clip) {
00752     vector<float> tmp;
00753     vector<int> myblemishes;
00754 
00755     float mt;
00756     long dumb_count;
00757 
00758     // dumbest possible blemish corrector
00759     // Clip large residuals to end
00760     dumb_count=0;
00761     mt=TypeIResidual(tmp,data,ref);
00762 
00763     for (int i=0; i<data.size(); i++) {
00764         if (tmp[i]>Clip) {
00765             data[i] = exp(ref[i]+Clip+mt);
00766             dumb_count++;
00767         }
00768         if (tmp[i]< (-1*Clip)) {
00769             data[i] = exp(ref[i]-Clip+mt);
00770             dumb_count++;
00771         }
00772     }
00773     Verbose::out(3, "Found " + ToStr(dumb_count) + " residuals");
00774 }
00775 
00776 void ArtifactReduction::GetReferenceProfile(IntensityMart* iMart){
00777 
00778     int channel_count = iMart->getChannelCount();
00779     //std::vector<string> CelFiles = iMart->getCelFileNames();
00780     m_CelFiles = iMart->getCelFileNames();
00781     int file_count = m_CelFiles.size();
00782 
00783     std::vector<float> data;
00784     std::vector<vector <float> > adata; // data over all channels
00785 
00786     if (m_ReferenceProfileName.empty()) {
00787         Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Computing reference profile for " +
00788                                ToStr(file_count) + " cel files",
00789                                file_count, 0, file_count);
00790 
00791         m_ReferenceProfile.clear();
00792         m_CurCount = 0;
00793         for (int d = 0; d < file_count; d++) {
00794             Verbose::progressStep(1);
00795             adata.clear();
00796             for (int cd=0; cd<channel_count; cd++){
00797                 data = iMart->getCelData(d, cd);
00798                 adata.push_back(data);
00799             }
00800             //updateReference(data);
00801             updateAllReference(adata);
00802         }
00803 
00804         Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00805     }
00806     else{
00807         Verbose::out(1, "Reading reference profile from: " +
00808                      m_ReferenceProfileName);
00809         readReferenceProfileFromFile(m_ReferenceProfileName);
00810     }
00811 }
00812 
00813 float ArtifactReduction::transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity, PsBoard &board) {
00814     int dsIx = chipIx / m_NumChannels;
00815     int channelIx = chipIx % m_NumChannels;
00816     APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_TransformedIMart == NULL, "Not expecting m_TransformedIMart to be set. Cel file: " +
00817                    m_TransformedIMart->getCelFileNames()[chipIx]);
00818     return m_DataCache->getProbeIntensity(probeIx, dsIx, channelIx);
00819 }
00820 
00821 float ArtifactReduction::transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity) {
00822     int dsIx = chipIx / m_NumChannels;
00823     int channelIx = chipIx % m_NumChannels;
00824     APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_TransformedIMart == NULL, "Not expecting m_TransformedIMart to be set. Cel file: " +
00825                    m_TransformedIMart->getCelFileNames()[chipIx]);
00826     return m_DataCache->getProbeIntensity(probeIx, dsIx, channelIx);
00827 }
00828 
00829 void ArtifactReduction::doReduction(IntensityMart* iMart) {
00830     
00831     // if there aren't any chipstream nodes after this, then don't store
00832     // all of the intensities
00833     if (m_Streams.empty()) {
00834         iMart->setStoreAllCelIntensities(false);
00835     }
00836 
00837     int channel_count = iMart->getChannelCount();
00838 
00839     //std::vector<string> CelFiles = iMart->getCelFileNames();
00840     int file_count = iMart->getCelFileCount();
00841 
00842     if (m_TrustCheck){
00843         m_ProbesetTrustTsv.defineColumn(0, 0, "chp_id");
00844         m_ProbesetTrustTsv.defineColumn(0, 1, "probeset_id");
00845         m_ProbesetTrustTsv.defineColumn(0, 2, "trust_count");
00846         APT_ERR_ASSERT( ! m_ProbesetTrustTmpFileName.empty(), "Empty temporay trusted file name.");
00847         m_ProbesetTrustTsv.writeTsv_v1( m_ProbesetTrustTmpFileName );
00848     }
00849 
00850     std::vector<float> data;
00851 
00852     std::vector<vector <float> > adata; // data over all channels
00853 
00854     if (m_ResType==1 || !m_ReferenceProfileName.empty() ||
00855         !m_FileOutName.empty())
00856 
00857         GetReferenceProfile(iMart);
00858 
00859     Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Applying artifact reduction to " +
00860                            ToStr(file_count) + " cel files", file_count, 0,
00861                            file_count);
00862     //Verbose::out(1, "Caching replicate probe list to apply to all cels");
00863     //FixProbeIterationList();
00864 
00865     for (int d = 0; d < file_count; d++) {
00866         Verbose::progressStep(1);
00867         adata.clear(); // remove entries from adata
00868         for (int cd=0; cd<channel_count; cd++) {
00869             data = iMart->getCelData(d, cd);
00870             adata.push_back(data); // add an element to adata
00871         }
00872 
00873         //Winsorize(data,2);
00874         if (m_MapVerbose==2)
00875             saveMultiChannelProfileToFile("origin." + ToStr(d) + ".txt",
00876                                           adata,"clip-profile");
00877 
00878         FixBlemish(adata,m_Clip,d);
00879         if (m_Gradient)
00880             FixGradient(adata,m_Clip,d);
00881 
00882         if (m_MapVerbose==2)
00883             saveMultiChannelProfileToFile("profile." + ToStr(d) + ".txt",
00884                                           adata,"clip-profile");
00885 
00886         for (int cd=0; cd<channel_count; cd++){
00887             iMart->setProbeIntensity(channel_count * d + cd,
00888                                      adata[cd]);}
00889     }
00890     Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00891 
00892     if (m_TrustCheck) {
00893         m_ProbesetTrustTsv.clear();
00894     }
00895 
00896 }
00897 
00898 /**
00899  * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data.
00900  * @param data - Vector of vectors of cel file data.
00901  */
00902 void ArtifactReduction::newDataSet(IntensityMart* iMart) {
00903     // set up the output Disk Mark
00904     m_TransformedIMart = iMart;
00905     doReduction(m_TransformedIMart);
00906     chipStreamPassNewChip(m_TransformedIMart);
00907 }
00908 
00909 void ArtifactReduction::newChip(std::vector<float> &data) {
00910     // If the data cache isn't set up yet, then get it going
00911     if (m_DataCache == NULL) {
00912         m_DataCache = new DataStore(m_DataStoreTempFile);
00913         vector<int> desiredOrder(data.size(), -1);
00914         for (int i = 0; i < data.size(); i++) {
00915             desiredOrder[i]  = i;
00916         }
00917         m_DataCache->setProbeOrder(desiredOrder);
00918         m_DataCache->initChannels(m_NumChannels);
00919     }
00920     // Just store the data for now, we'll process it in finishedChips
00921     int dataCount = Max(m_DataCache->getCelDataSetCount(), 0);
00922     m_DataCache->writeColumn(dataCount, ToStr(dataCount), data);
00923     if (dataCount % m_NumChannels == 0) {
00924         m_CacheCelNames.push_back(ToStr(m_CacheCelNames.size()));
00925     }
00926 }
00927 
00928 void ArtifactReduction::finishedChips() {
00929     m_DataCache->setCelFileNames(m_CacheCelNames);
00930     doReduction(m_DataCache);
00931 }
00932 
00933 /**
00934  * @brief Signal that no more data is coming (i.e. newChip() will not be
00935  * called anymore. Currently the class builds up all the sketches and then
00936  * does the normalization when this function is called. This makes it
00937  * difficult to pass through data to downstream. If a precomputed sketch
00938  * is supplied then the data can be passed through chip by chip.
00939  */
00940 void ArtifactReduction::endDataSet() {
00941     /* Flush data in stream. */
00942     chipStreamEndChips();
00943 
00944 
00945     if (m_FileOutName !="") {
00946         saveMultiChannelProfileToFile(m_FileOutName, m_AllReferenceProfile,
00947                                       "mc-profile");
00948     }
00949     if (m_a5_filename!="") {
00950         saveReferenceProfileToFile_a5(m_a5_filename);
00951     }
00952     if (m_a5_shared_group!=NULL) {
00953         saveReferenceProfileToGroup_a5(m_a5_shared_group);
00954     }
00955 }
00956 
00957 /// i/o stuff past here
00958 
00959 /**
00960  * Open and read a target distribution from a text file. Must have a column
00961  * called 'intensities' with distribution quantiles sorted from highest to
00962  * lowest.
00963  *
00964  * @param fileName - text file containing column of quantiles.
00965  */
00966 void ArtifactReduction::readReferenceProfileFromFile(const std::string& fileName) {
00967     TsvFile tsv;
00968     double intensity;
00969     // file ok
00970     if (File5_File::isHdf5file(fileName)==1) {
00971         Err::errAbort("A5 implementation of reference-profile is not yet implemented.");
00972     }
00973     int rc = tsv.open(fileName);
00974     assert(rc==TSV_OK);
00975     //
00976     tsv.bind(0,"intensities",&intensity,affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00977 
00978     m_ReferenceProfile.clear();
00979     while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00980         m_ReferenceProfile.push_back(intensity);
00981     }
00982 
00983     tsv.close();
00984 }
00985 
00986 
00987 void ArtifactReduction::readMultiChannelReferenceProfileFromFile(const std::string& fileName) {
00988     TsvFile tsv;
00989     double intensity = -1;
00990     // file ok
00991     if (File5_File::isHdf5file(fileName)==1) {
00992         Err::errAbort("A5 implementation of reference-profile is not yet implemented.");
00993     }
00994     int rc = tsv.open(fileName);
00995     assert(rc==TSV_OK);
00996     //
00997     //tsv.bind(0,"intensities",&intensity,affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00998     vector<int> ch_cidx;
00999     ch_cidx.assign(tsv.getColumnCount(0),-1); // no data yet for channels
01000     for (int cd=0; cd<ch_cidx.size(); cd++) {
01001         ch_cidx[cd]=tsv.cname2cidx(0,"channel"+ToStr(cd));
01002     }
01003 
01004     m_AllReferenceProfile.clear();
01005     m_AllReferenceProfile.resize(ch_cidx.size());
01006     while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
01007         for (int cd=0; cd<ch_cidx.size(); cd++) {
01008             if (ch_cidx[cd]>=0) {
01009                 tsv.get(0,ch_cidx[cd], intensity);
01010             }
01011             m_AllReferenceProfile[cd].push_back(intensity);
01012         }
01013     }
01014 
01015     tsv.close();
01016 }
01017 
01018 void ArtifactReduction::readReferenceProfileFromFile_a5(const std::string& fileName) {
01019     affx::File5_File* file5=new affx::File5_File();
01020     file5->open(fileName,affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
01021 
01022     readReferenceProfileFromFile_a5_tsv(file5,"reference-profile");
01023 
01024     file5->close();
01025     delete file5;
01026 }
01027 
01028 void ArtifactReduction::readReferenceProfileFromFile_a5_tsv(affx::File5_Group* group5, const std::string& name) {
01029     //printf("### reading A5 profile from: '%s'\n",name.c_str());
01030     double intensity;
01031     affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5=group5->openTsv("reference-profile",
01032                                           affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
01033 
01034     m_ReferenceProfile.clear();
01035     while (tsv5->nextLine()==affx::FILE5_OK) {
01036         tsv5->get(0,0,&intensity);
01037         m_ReferenceProfile.push_back(intensity);
01038     }
01039     //
01040     tsv5->close();
01041     delete tsv5;
01042 }
01043 
01044 void ArtifactReduction::saveReferenceProfileToFile(const std::string &fileName) {
01045     saveProfileToFile(fileName,m_ReferenceProfile,"reference-profile");
01046 }
01047 
01048 /**
01049  * Save the current m_ReferenceProfile to a file.
01050  * @param fileName - where to write the profile.
01051  */
01052 void ArtifactReduction::saveProfileToFile(const std::string& fileName,
01053                                           std::vector<float> &Profile,
01054                                           const std::string &ProfileType) {
01055 
01056     affx::TsvFile tsv;
01057     tsv.addHeader("tsv-file-type",ProfileType);
01058     tsv.defineFile("intensities");
01059     tsv.setPrecision(0,0,8);
01060     tsv.writeTsv_v1(fileName);
01061     //
01062     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < Profile.size(); i++) {
01063         tsv.set(0,0,Profile[i]);
01064         tsv.writeLevel(0);
01065     }
01066     tsv.close();
01067 }
01068 
01069 /**
01070  * Save the current residuals to a file.
01071  * @param fileName - where to write the profile.
01072  */
01073 void ArtifactReduction::saveResidualsToFile(const std::string& fileName,
01074                                             std::vector<float> &Residuals,
01075                                             const std::string &ResidualType) {
01076 
01077     affx::TsvFile tsv;
01078     tsv.addHeader("tsv-file-type",ResidualType);
01079     tsv.defineFile("LogResiduals");
01080     tsv.setPrecision(0,0,8);
01081     tsv.writeTsv_v1(fileName);
01082     //
01083     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < Residuals.size(); i++) {
01084         tsv.set(0,0,Residuals[i]);
01085         tsv.writeLevel(0);
01086     }
01087     tsv.close();
01088 }
01089 
01090 /**
01091  * Save the current m_ReferenceProfile to a file.
01092  * @param fileName - where to write the profile.
01093  */
01094 void ArtifactReduction::saveMultiChannelProfileToFile(const std::string& fileName, std::vector<std::vector<float> > &Profile, const std::string &ProfileType) {
01095 
01096     affx::TsvFile tsv;
01097     string t_col;
01098 
01099     tsv.addHeader("tsv-file-type",ProfileType);
01100 
01101     for (int cd=0; cd<Profile.size(); cd++) {
01102         t_col = "channel" + ToStr(cd);
01103         tsv.defineColumn(0,cd,t_col);
01104         tsv.setPrecision(0,cd, 6);
01105     }
01106     tsv.writeTsv_v1(fileName);
01107     // loop over all entries, loop over all columns
01108     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < Profile[0].size(); i++) {
01109         for (int cd=0; cd<Profile.size(); cd++) {
01110             tsv.set(0,cd,Profile[cd][i]);
01111         }
01112         tsv.writeLevel(0);
01113     }
01114     tsv.close();
01115 }
01116

01118 /**
01119  * Save the current BlemishMap to a file.
01120  * @param fileName - where to write the profile.
01121  */
01122 void ArtifactReduction::saveBlemishMapToFile(const std::string& fileName,
01123                                              std::vector<int> &Profile,
01124                                              const std::string &ProfileType) {
01125 
01126     affx::TsvFile tsv;
01127     tsv.addHeader("tsv-file-type",ProfileType);
01128     tsv.defineFile("artifact");
01129     tsv.setPrecision(0,0,8);
01130     tsv.writeTsv_v1(fileName);
01131     //
01132     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < Profile.size(); i++) {
01133         tsv.set(0,0,Profile[i]);
01134         tsv.writeLevel(0);
01135     }
01136     tsv.close();
01137 }
01138 
01139 void ArtifactReduction::saveReferenceProfileToFile_a5(const std::string& fileName) {
01140     try {
01141         affx::File5_File* file5=new affx::File5_File();
01142         file5->open(fileName,affx::FILE5_REPLACE);
01143 
01144         saveReferenceProfileToGroup_a5(file5);
01145 
01146         file5->close();
01147         delete file5;
01148     }
01149     catch(...) {
01150         Err::errAbort("Cannot open file: " + fileName);
01151     }
01152 }
01153 
01154 void ArtifactReduction::saveReferenceProfileToGroup_a5(affx::File5_Group* group5) {
01155     //
01156     affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5=group5->openTsv("reference-profile",affx::FILE5_CREATE);
01157     tsv5->defineColumn(0,0,"intensities",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE,0);
01158     //
01159     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ReferenceProfile.size(); i++) {
01160         tsv5->set_d(0,0,m_ReferenceProfile[i]);
01161         tsv5->writeLevel(0);
01162     }
01163     //
01164     tsv5->close();
01165     delete tsv5;
01166 }
01167 
01168 std::string ArtifactReduction::createProbesetTrustTmpFileName( Options *opt)
01169 {
01170     std::string trustFileName = Fs::basename(GlobalTmpFileFactory()->genFilename_basic(std::string(ARTIFACTREDUCTIONSTR) + ".",".trust"));
01171     trustFileName = Fs::join(opt->getOpt("temp-dir"), trustFileName + ".tsv" );
01172     return trustFileName;
01173 }
01174 
01175 void ArtifactReduction::setParameters(PsBoard &board) {
01176     string spfFile;
01177     // @todo refactor - Just read the chiplayout directly from blackboard for now...ChipLayout
01178     board.get("chiplayout", &m_pobjChipLayout);
01179     m_NumChannels = m_pobjChipLayout->numChannels();
01180     Options *o = board.getOptions();
01181     setreadReferenceProfile(o->getOpt("reference-profile"));
01182     // @todo refactor - get the write profile working by setting the output directory
01183     // if (!o->getOptBool("write-profile")) {
01184     //     string outFile = m_WriteProfileDir + description + s->getType() + ToStr(".generic-target.txt");
01185     //     saveReferenceProfile(outFile);
01186     // }
01187     
01188     m_ProbesetTrustTmpFileName = createProbesetTrustTmpFileName(o);
01189     
01190     board.set(getProbesetTrustFileKey(), m_ProbesetTrustTmpFileName);
01191     m_DataStoreTempFile = Fs::join(o->getOpt("temp-dir"),"artifact-reduction-temp.a5");
01192 }
